name: Sporty Bern - City Tour by scooter
abstract: When was the last time you rode a scooter? Well now you’ve got the chance!
description: Glide at your own pace along the Aare River through the old Matte District, then take the Marzili cable-railway to the upper city. From there, you’ll ride to the historical sites, perhaps take a refreshing break beneath the fountains on Parliament Square (Bundesplatz) and listen to the stories and anecdotes told by the guides.

image.name: Sporty Bern - City Tour by scooter

name: Farm Olympics in Bern
abstract: A totally Swiss experience! Who's going to win Olympic gold in the cow milking or blowpipe competition?
description: The group can have its very own Olympic Games on one of many farms – all within 20 minutes of Bern. Choose the type and number of games based on your group's interests and budget.

name: Criss-crossing Bern by bike
abstract: Get an authentic feel for Switzerland’s capital by bike, just like a local.
description:
Whether cycling through Breitsch (Breitenrain) or Lorraine, along Länggasse or down to the Marzili – you can reach everywhere in Bern fast and easily by bike. And if you don’t have your own bike, you can rent one from the PubliBike bike-sharing network: bikes and e-bikes are standing at the ready at a number of stations across the city. Simply download the PubliBike app and off you go!

Bikesharing in Bern [http://www.bern.com/en/detail/bikesharing-in-bern]

The most beautiful bike routes in and around Bern [https://www.bern.com/de/velo/velo-routen]

additionalDescriptions.description: What could be more inspirational for those taking part in your seminar than a mountain and glacier landscape viewed at 3,400 m above sea level? With all-year-round attractions on the Jungfraujoch - Top of Europe, your event becomes an unforgettable summit on the summit. The Bollywood restaurant is open from the beginning of April to the end of October.

name: Observation Terrace Sphinx
abstract: The Jungfraujoch is not only an attractive vantage point, but also an ideal location for various research projects in the fields of geology, astronomy, and more.
description: The laboratories are not open to the public, but their fantastic viewing terraces can be visited by all. They offer a panoramic view of the Alps and guarantee an unforgettable experience. Enjoy the high alpine wonderland of ice, snow and rock around the Aletsch Glacier, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The Sphinx is located at 3571 meters above sea level. Europe’s highest railway station, nicknamed “Top of Europe” for that reason, is located in the interior of the Sphinx. A path specially prepared for leisurely walks leads from the Jungfraujoch to the Mönchsjoch Hut. The walk takes 1.5 hours, depending on weather conditions.

name: Glacier Adventure on Jungfraujoch
abstract: Immerse yourself in the glacial world of the Jungfrau-Aletsch UNESCO World Heritage Site on a glacier hike and experience the magnificent alpine mountain landscape up close.
description:
Hiking across the imposing Aletsch Glacier is always an unforgettable experience. Surrounded by the most famous 4,000m peaks of the Bernese and Valais Alps, passing imposing crevasses and enjoying a breathtaking view of the immense alpine glaciers.

This unique adventure begins as soon as we collect you from the meeting point and accompany you on the journey by gondola lift and train to the Jungfraujoch. The Jungfraujoch is located on the main European water divide (Rhône/Rhine) at 3,454m above sea level, making this the highest train station in Europe.
Once you are roped up and equipped with a climbing harness and a ski pole, our IFMGA mountain guides will skillfully guide you across the glacier.

As we hike across the glacier, our guides will explain how we promote sustainability and the importance of preserving the alpine glacial region.
One of our focal points is climate change, one of the main causes of glacier melt. You will learn how climate change affects the glaciers, the impact this has on the ecosystem and the water cycle, and the importance of taking steps to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in order to slow down glacier retreat.

The walking distance and the speed of our progress on the glacier can be individually adapted to the needs of your group. After a break, you will visit the majestic Jungfraujoch under the watchful eye of your OUTDOOR guides. Visitors cannot fail to be impressed by this extensive and striking complex, planned and subsequently built in true pioneering spirit at the end of the 19th century.
The Jungfraujoch building is a prime example of sustainable planning and construction. The pioneering construction and the maintenance of the facility are perfect examples of sustainable building and the careful handling of sensitive alpine areas.

We visit the highest vantage point on the Jungfraujoch, the “Sphinx”, the Ice Palace with its examples of ice art, the glacier plateau and follow the “Alpine Sensation” tour, which provides us with musical accompaniment and interesting information about the planning and construction work on the Jungfraujoch. Along the way, you will learn key facts about the construction and maintenance of the Jungfraujoch and the ways in which it benefits science and the tourism industry.

This group activity on the glacier promotes team building, addresses the importance of preserving the alpine region, raises awareness and motivates visitors to make the long-term sacrifices needed to secure the future of the glaciers.

name: Harderbahn
abstract: In just ten minutes, the panorama funicular takes guests from Interlaken up to its local mountain Harder Kulm.
description:
For more than 100 years, the funicular has been negotiating the 735 meters of altitude to the Harder Kulm, located at 1322 meters. The journey starts not far from Interlaken Ost station, leads through a charming forest and passes the wildlife park. A five-minute walk takes visitors from the mountain station to the lovely restaurant with turrets and a red tile roof. Next to the restaurant, guests may visit the “Two-Lakes-Bridge” and an airy viewing platform with a glass area in its floor. From there, truly deep sights can be seen and the magnificent view to Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau as well as Lakes Brienz and Thun can be savoured.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 1322 m a.s.l. Arrival: Walkway (7 min) from Interlaken Ost station to Harder railway, funicular to Harder Kulm Timetable: Operates during the summer season in 30-minute intervals.Timetable [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/live/operating-info/]

Travel duration to summit: 10 mins Attractions: “Floating” triangular viewing platform Culinary aspects: Pavilion style restaurant
Specials: Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard.
Buy your tickets [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/harder-kulm/]



MOUNTAIN DAY TRIPS
Buy your mountain rail ascent return tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/en/buying/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=HarderKulm]

name: Grindelwald First
abstract: The First is an ideal starting point for action-packed hikes, the new “First Cliff Walk by Tissot” being a prime example.
description:
The cable car whisks you in three stages from the valley station to Grindelwald First at 2,168 metres above sea level, a hotspot for connoisseurs and adventurers alike. The summit tempts visitors with breathtaking views of the north face of the Eiger and wonderful hikes. Lasting around two hours, the leisurely hike to the Bachalpsee lake is a must for anyone visiting the First area. The snow-capped Alpine peaks are reflected in the crystal-clear blue water – a pure mountain idyll!

Whether you opt for the 800-metre First Flyer zipline or a high-octane scooter ride, a rush of speed and adrenaline is guaranteed. The First Flyer enables brave souls to glide through the air for 800 metres at speeds of up to 84km/h. Children can enjoy the 700-square metre playground at the Bort middle station.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 2,166 metres above sea level How to get there: Train from Interlaken to Grindelwald, walk through the village (20 minutes), three-stage gondola to First Timetable: Operates during the summer season (April to October) Journey time: 25 minutes to the summit Attractions: First Flyer, First Cliff Walk, hike to the Bachalpsee lake, mountain hike to the Faulhorn and on to Schynige Platte (only in summer), high-altitude hike to Grosse Scheidegg (bus connections in summer) Food and drink: “Restaurant First” with seating for 350, sun terrace with seating for 300
Special comments: First Mountain Cart from Schreckfeld to Bort Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard: 
Your return ticket to the Grindelwald valley station is included in the price. Buy your discounted cable car tickets here [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/grindelwaldfirst/]. 



DAY TRIPS TO THE MOUNTAINS
Buy your return rail and mountain ascent tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/de/kaufen/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=First(Grindelwald)]

name: Schynige Platte
abstract: This great experience starts right when guests step into the coaches of the nostalgic cog railway. And the higher the train climbs, the more breathtaking becomes the mountain view that reveals itself.
description:
Guests visiting the Schynige Platte, located right at the heart of the Jungfrau region, on the historic cog railway instantly feel carried back to the Belle Époche. The wooden benches in the coaches of the nostalgic train as well as the vintage rolling stock dating from the nineteenth century exude the flair of times long past and revive the spirit of a bygone era.

 The mountain station at 1,967 meters is the starting point for various delightful circular hikes. It’s also home to the Alpine Botanic Garden [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/alpine-botanic-garden/] with some 800 plant species. The magnificent view can best be savoured from the panorama restaurant “Schynige Platte”, where guests are treated to delicious Swiss specialities as well as international dishes.

INFORMATION
Altitude: 1,967 m.a.s.l. Arrival: Railway from Interlaken Ost to Wilderswil, cog railway to Schynige Platte Timetable: Operates only during summer (June to October) Travel duration to summit: 52 minutes Attractions:  * Coach drive on the steep cog railway
 * Perfect panoramic view of Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau as well as Lakes Thun and Brienz
 * Free admission to the Botanic Alpine Garden with roughly 800 alpine flowers and plant species
 * “Swiss Flower Panorama Trail” with photo spot
 * Lily’s alpine playground and treasure hunt

Food & beverage:  * Mountain hotel with restaurant and spacious sun terrace
 * Snack-hut directly at the Schynige Platte station
 * “Bistro Breitlauenen” (intermediate station)

Specials: Daylong hike Faulhorn-Grindelwald/First, daily musical entertainment of Alphorn blowers, nature cinema and small railway exhibition in the mountain hotel Schynige Platte, barbecue area and leisurely panorama circular hiking trails (30 minutes to 2.5 hours), nostalgic steam train rides
Please note: Reduced rate mountain rail ascent with the Swiss Travel Pass / GA travelcard
Buy your tickets upon arrival at the station or online [https://www.jungfrau.ch/en-gb/schynige-platte/schynige-platte-ticket/] 

MOUNTAIN DAY TRIPS
Buy your mountain rail ascent return tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/en/buying/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=SchynigePlatte ]

name: Giessbach Funicular Railway
abstract: Despite undergoing a number of technical updates, the funicular railway still radiates the same nostalgic charm and romance it did way back in 1879.
description:
The funicular climbs 93 metres along the 345-metre track from the hotel’s own landing stage (Giessbach See) to the enchanting Grand Hotel overlooking Lake Brienz. The four-minute journey takes you through the forest, over bridges and alongside waterfalls. 

The cascading waterfalls above can be reached on foot. There is even a path that runs behind the water, so you don’t get wet.INFORMATION

Altitude: 666 metres 
How to get there: 
Travel by boat across Lake Brienz from Interlaken Ost or Brienz to Giessbach See, then take the funicular to the hotel and waterfall
Also accessible by car 
Views: Towards the waterfall, across Lake Brienz to the Rothorn 
Attractions: Historic hotel, historic funicular, waterfall with 14 cascades over 500 metres 
Food and drink: “Les Cascades” fine dining restaurant 
Accommodation: 70 romantic rooms, tower room and suites 
Groups: Range of modern conference and meeting rooms (6 rooms, detailed conference and seminar brochure), banquets for up to 200 people 
Winter: Hotel only opens in winter for special occasions 
Special comments: An oasis of calm far away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life

name: GoldenPass Express
abstract: The GoldenPass Express redefines the travel experience between Interlaken and Montreux.
description:
SEAMLESS TRAVEL EXPERIENCE
The GoldenPass Express provides a seamless and even more comfortable travel experience on one of Switzerland’s most picturesque train routes. The panoramic train will connect Interlaken with Montreux up to four times a day, offering uninterrupted views of the breathtaking panorama.PRESTIGE
The travel class “Prestige” is the centrepiece of the train. It offers everything you would expect from an unforgettable train journey: plenty of privacy, maximum comfort in a small compartment, and an exceptional culinary offering.

Make yourself comfortable on the luxurious and heated leather seats, which can be rotated 180 degrees upon request. The travel class is also elevated by 40 cm compared to the other travel classes, offering you an even better view of the fascinating scenery.

CULINARY DELIGHTS ON THE GOLDENPASS EXPRESS
Local and international delicacies can be ordered in advance, ensuring a perfect start to an exciting journey. For example, how about a glass of champagne and a portion of the finest caviar from Frutigen in Switzerland?

If you prefer to pamper your palate with regional delicacies, you won’t be disappointed with a traditional apéro-plate or a vegetarian alternative. While champagne and caviar are served exclusively in “Prestige” and 1st class, you can enjoy selected dishes from the small but exquisite menu in all travel classes.

WORLD-FAMOUS PLACES, THREE REGIONS
The journey on the GoldenPass Express is like a foray through Switzerland. The trip starts in picturesque Interlaken and continues via Gstaad, Château-d’Oex and Montbovon to Montreux, the journey’s final stop. Of course, you can also start your trip in Montreux.

Interlaken is a great base for numerous activities and boasts incredible views of Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau. Luxurious Gstaad is known for its charming chalets and is a favourite holiday spot among stars and winter sports enthusiasts alike. Château-d’Oex is known for its hot air balloons and, with a little luck, you might spot one aloft. Montreux, of course, is home to the annual Montreux Jazz Festival [https://www.montreuxjazzfestival.com/en/].


SWISSNESS
The GoldenPass Express is a world-first and a Swiss masterstroke. After all, the idea of connecting Interlaken and Montreux without needing to change trains originated more than 100 years ago. The project never materialised, however, because of the different track gauges of the respective sections of the line. But this seemingly impossible challenge could now be solved by an ingenious invention: adjustable bogies.
GOLDENPASS EXPRESS TIMETABLE


The current timetable as well as additional information can be found here [https://www.gpx.swiss/en/pages/timetable].


RESERVATIONS AND SURCHARGES
Due to limited seating capacity, reservations are mandatory in “Prestige” (CHF 49) and strongly recommended for 1st and 2nd class travel. This is in addition to a valid ticket for the selected travel class.

The only thing you might find disappointing? The entire trip lasts just 3 hours 15 minutes. With those stunning views and unrivalled comfort, the journey is just as spectacular as the destination.


SWISS TRAVEL PASS
This route is fully included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) / GA Travelcard, though seat reservations must be paid for separately. 
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]

name: Interlaken Free Walking Tour
abstract: Interlaken – a jewel in the midst of the Swiss Alps. A local guide shares exciting facts about Interlaken and its environs with the guests. They will visit secret spots that only the locals know, looking at them through their eyes.
description: The very first tour of this kind in Switzerland has been very well received by all guests. The guides are from the region. They know the area, its history and secrets and have excellent language skills, especially in English, but they are fluent in other languages as well. In addition to the professional organisation, the tours are fresh, exciting and entertaining. The two-hour event is free, but the guests have an opportunity to tip the guide at the end.

name: Interlaken - the paradise for water sports
abstract: The region around Interlaken offers a variety of water sports and thus, fun and excitement for everyone.
description:
Whether an intoxicating kayak tour on the glassy surface of Lake Brienz or a ride on the waves of a wild mountain stream; the region around Interlaken offers water sports enthusiasts a large choice. During guided tours, which do not require any prior knowledge, hikers get to enjoy the breathtaking nature or search for the next adrenaline rush.

These are the activities on offer: 

• SUP 
• kayaking 
• canoeing 
• canyoning 
• river rafting 
• boat hire 
• wakesurfing 
• water skiing 
• wakeboarding 
• pedaloing

More information [http://www.interlaken.ch/en/activities-excursions-adventure-festivals/summer-sports-and-adventure/water-sports-interlaken.html]

name: Paradise for adventure and paragliding
abstract: Interlaken is the number one place for fun and adventure sports. For paragliding fans, Interlaken has long been known for its excellent flying opportunities and nearly year-round good conditions.
description:
On a round tour of the Alps you can enjoy the high-alpine panorama, or on a hang-gliding or paragliding trip you can admire the scenery somewhat more closely while a parachute jump will certainly get your adrenalin going.

Tandem flights: in Interlaken there is a wide range of unique opportunities for paragliding and seeing extraordinary views of the lakes and mountains. As a passenger, you need no previous experience; you are given a few instructions and then a few steps later you lift off with your pilot. Getting an unusual bird's eye view of the unique Jungfrau panorama is sure to make you forget everything else for a while!
Nothing can beat the flight down from the Beatenberg to Interlaken for excitement and a really special experience.

name: Trail of the Three Waterfalls
abstract: Water may splash, and it can also babble, hiss, roar and thunder. For an exhilarating hike try the Trail of the Three Waterfalls from Bönigen via Iseltwald to Brienz.
description:
Begin of tour: ship station Bönigen Point of arrival: ship station Brienz Access starting point: bus, train or ship Access point of arrival: bus, train or ship Physical fitness: medium Difficulty: medium Hiking time: Total 5h15 / sections 2-4h possible Length: 18.2 km 
This hike is a very special experience for families as it is for all hikers young and old. The walk takes you to three spectacular waterfalls in the Interlaken holiday region. Depending on fitness levels the trail can be covered at one time or in three easy stages.

From Bönigen, Iseltwald, Giessbach and Brienz each of the other stations may be reached by boat, bus or train.

name: River rafting Lütschine
description: The mighty Lütschine river offers exciting wildwater rafting, creating rapids as it surges down from the mountains. Led by an experienced guide, this rafting tour takes you on an exhilarating ride from Interlaken to turquoise Lake Brienz, where the journey comes to a tranquil end.

name: Canyoning for beginners
description: Those taking part in this taster tour will meet at the base in Interlaken. After brief instruction, the guide will give guests their equipment and take them up into the canyon. Over half a day in Bach, the group the will experience canyoning in all its great variety, climbing, sliding, abseiling and jumping into deep pools of water. Should something be a little too difficult, there is always an easier alternative.

name: Mürrenbahn
abstract: Since 2006, visitors have been able to ascend the first 685 meters of the Grütschalp (1481 meters) by aerial cable car.
description:
From Lauterbrunnen to Grütschalp 
Since 2006, visitors have been able to ascend the first 685 meters of the Grütschalp (1481 meters) by aerial cable car. The cable car can accommodate 100 persons on each ride. At the same time it can carry 6,000 kilograms of freight. The ride takes 4 minutes. 

From Grütschalp to Mürren 
An adhesion railway runs on the romantic stretch across alpine meadows to Mürren. This ride traverses an additional 147 meters. 

Mürren is not accessible by car. For this reason freight transport is especially important. Transportation is carried out by means of containers, which are transferred to the freight compartment of the adhesion train at the intermediate station’s ultra-modern loading facility. 

The Lauterbrunnen-Mürren mountain train was opened in 1891. There is an additional means of traveling to Mürren: by aerial cable car from Stechelberg (the aerial cable car continues onward via Gimmelwald to Schilthorn).

name: Funky chocolate club Interlaken
description: Welcome to the sweet universe of Tatjana and Michaela. In their chocolate studio in Interlaken the guests produce their own masterpiece from 400 g of Swiss chocolate. The chocolate makers help with melting and decorating. The guests can then take their chocolate souvenir home.

price.description: CHF 65.00 per adult CHF 59.00 per child

name: Raclette rafting
abstract: Enjoy a tasty raclette while drifting on a rafting boat from the quay in Bönigen through the ship canal to Interlaken.
description: The raft is stable and the tours take place in the evening. While the lights in the houses of Interlaken slowly go on along the banks, guests snuggle down in warm blankets to enjoy a feast of melted cheese and a glass of wine. The views of the snow-covered mountains in the background complement the idyllic cityscape. The reliable guides steer the vessel, so that guests can enjoy the time on the raclette raft.

name: Live Escape Adventure
abstract: MysteryRooms is a special Escape games, adventure games and team building events company. Whether for singles, couples, large groups, or corporate customers MysteryRooms develops special experience events that not only guarantee a high fun factor, but also promote team spirit and also require logical thinking.
description:
At the Interlaken location, there are two MysteryRooms that promise a lot of puzzle fun:

"The Secret of the Captain" is our game of chance and is particularly well suited as a first experience. The players are in the nostalgically furnished room of the Captain. The innovative rippled design offers exciting challenges in the areas of combining & concentrating, searching & finding as well as dexterity and sensor technology. A game that is played with all your senses.

Mind Games
The space of the player
Modern design, high-tech puzzles of cables, lights and computers and board games combine to make this interactive puzzle fun. You are in the room of the player, who seems to be a very sophisticated fellow and puts you to the test with tricky puzzles. You do not need to be a chess world champion to play mind games, but logical thinking and team spirit, as well as skill, is important to unlock the player's secret

name: Snowshoes, moon and fondue
abstract: Tramp through the night and the snow under the full moon or the new moon in style.
description:
"On the Lombachalp above Interlaken, guests strike the perfect balance between tranquillity and sports. This guided night-time snowshoe tour is an experience that is in a class of its own. The nocturnal atmosphere underneath the starry sky is so beautiful, you’re bound to fall in love with it. Accompanied by a mountain guide and equipped with a head torch, guests tramp through the enchanting winter landscape. All you can hear is your breathing and the crunch of the snow under your snowshoes. Step by step, you will advance through the atmospheric night, marvelling at the sea of lights in the valley, the snow glistening in the moonlight and the stars twinkling in the night sky. There is tea and mulled wine to warm you up along the way. At the end of the tour, guests can look forward to a fine cheese fondue in the Jägerstübli restaurant. 

"

image.name: Lombachalp, Schneeschuhtrail
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use / mike kaufmann

name: Alpine games team challenge
abstract: A variety of team challenges with the potential to unlock positive emotions are on offer in the heart of the fascinating Jungfrau mountain region.
description:
Divided into teams, you will compete in various challenging disciplines in a bid to take the title, with lots of laughs along the way.
Whether you prefer an alpine game that requires participants to demonstrate their skills, carry out traditional Swiss customs or simply rely on luck, the choice is endless. We would be happy to help you choose the games and plan your stay.
Once the game is done, why not celebrate the results over an aperitif or meal with regional produce from the Jungfrau region, sharing any outstanding achievements and laughing about any mishaps along the way.
Shared adventures in unique natural surroundings not only promote team spirit, but also highlight the importance of a sustainable corporate event. All our games require nothing but manpower, the venue is located in the heart of nature and is easily accessible by public transport – usually by train or, for an even more spectacular arrival, by gondola lift.
We aim to play our part by ensuring that our events are not only entertaining but also have a positive impact on the environment. Thatʼs why we make sure that our games are environmentally friendly and sustainable.

Our current range of games includes the following activities and is continuously updated:

 * Alpine horn challenge
 * Labyrinth
 * Eiger North Face climb
 * Milk stool curling
 * Maxi ski racing
 * Maxi Jenga
 * Snow sculpture making
 * Snowbike & sled trail
 * Photo shoot
 * Flag throwing

As organisers of corporate events, we attach great importance to sustainability and the responsible use of natural resources.

name: Lavaux vineyards
abstract: Explore the terraced vineyards of Lavaux. Of the six Vaudois wine regions, the UNESCO "Lavaux" region (between Lausanne and Montreux) is undoubtedly the most spectacular.
description:
The steep terraced vineyards benefit from three-fold warmth from solar, thermal and radiation sources: Directly from the sun, mirrored reflections from Lake Geneva and that of heat stored in the many stone walls in the surroundings. No wonder that this is the source of Switzerland’s Grand Crus in wine. 

Take to the train, your bicycle or even walk to discover the 800 hectares of terraced vineyards of the Lavaux that have been accorded UNESCO World-Heritage listing. A footpath of 32 km in length leads from Lausanne-Ouchy to Chillon Castle. En route you'll find 7 circuits complete with information panels detailing every facet of local viticulture. Taste locally produced wines in an authentic wine cellar and learns more about local wine growing culture and grape varieties.FROM VINE TO WINE IN LAVAUX
Assist a Lavaux winemaker in his daily work and enjoy an authentic experience of man and vine. This half-day of discovery includes working in the vineyard or the cellar (depending on the season), visiting the estate, wine tasting with a snack and a bottle of wine to take home as a souvenir. All reservations must, if possible, be made at least one week in advance.
Duration: 3h
Number of participants: 2-10
Languages: German, English, French

More information [https://www.region-du-leman.ch/en/Z9278/lavaux-unesco-terraced-vineyards?utm_campaign=dieschweizelektrisiert&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=myswitzerand&utm_content=de&utm_term=lavaux]

name: Lavaux Unesco exklusive Tour
abstract: If you're looking for an exclusive event related to wine tasting or gastronomy, then Swiss Riviera Wine Tours can help you! They offer exciting possibilities and customized solutions for your special event needs.
description:
Swiss Riviera Wine Tours has created a spectacular wine tour that will invigorate moral and strengthen the bonds of your group. They integrate fun, educative, and relaxing elements in this tour in order to stimulate the team around this exceptionally unique Lavaux region, called the “Three Suns” – those of the sky, the lake and the walls. Fashioned through the ages by human activity, this territory has become a “constructed” countryside, typical of a winegrowing culture. Vineyards, terraces and villages facing Lake Geneva and the Alps have enabled Lavaux to be considered as a site of universal, exceptional and authentic value. 

Japanese, Chinese, Portugese, Spanish, Arabic and Russian with additional fee for translator

name: GoldenPass Express
abstract: The GoldenPass Express redefines the travel experience between Interlaken and Montreux.
description:
SEAMLESS TRAVEL EXPERIENCE
The GoldenPass Express provides a seamless and even more comfortable travel experience on one of Switzerland’s most picturesque train routes. The panoramic train will connect Interlaken with Montreux up to four times a day, offering uninterrupted views of the breathtaking panorama.PRESTIGE
The travel class “Prestige” is the centrepiece of the train. It offers everything you would expect from an unforgettable train journey: plenty of privacy, maximum comfort in a small compartment, and an exceptional culinary offering.

Make yourself comfortable on the luxurious and heated leather seats, which can be rotated 180 degrees upon request. The travel class is also elevated by 40 cm compared to the other travel classes, offering you an even better view of the fascinating scenery.

CULINARY DELIGHTS ON THE GOLDENPASS EXPRESS
Local and international delicacies can be ordered in advance, ensuring a perfect start to an exciting journey. For example, how about a glass of champagne and a portion of the finest caviar from Frutigen in Switzerland?

If you prefer to pamper your palate with regional delicacies, you won’t be disappointed with a traditional apéro-plate or a vegetarian alternative. While champagne and caviar are served exclusively in “Prestige” and 1st class, you can enjoy selected dishes from the small but exquisite menu in all travel classes.

WORLD-FAMOUS PLACES, THREE REGIONS
The journey on the GoldenPass Express is like a foray through Switzerland. The trip starts in picturesque Interlaken and continues via Gstaad, Château-d’Oex and Montbovon to Montreux, the journey’s final stop. Of course, you can also start your trip in Montreux.

Interlaken is a great base for numerous activities and boasts incredible views of Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau. Luxurious Gstaad is known for its charming chalets and is a favourite holiday spot among stars and winter sports enthusiasts alike. Château-d’Oex is known for its hot air balloons and, with a little luck, you might spot one aloft. Montreux, of course, is home to the annual Montreux Jazz Festival [https://www.montreuxjazzfestival.com/en/].


SWISSNESS
The GoldenPass Express is a world-first and a Swiss masterstroke. After all, the idea of connecting Interlaken and Montreux without needing to change trains originated more than 100 years ago. The project never materialised, however, because of the different track gauges of the respective sections of the line. But this seemingly impossible challenge could now be solved by an ingenious invention: adjustable bogies.
GOLDENPASS EXPRESS TIMETABLE


The current timetable as well as additional information can be found here [https://www.gpx.swiss/en/pages/timetable].


RESERVATIONS AND SURCHARGES
Due to limited seating capacity, reservations are mandatory in “Prestige” (CHF 49) and strongly recommended for 1st and 2nd class travel. This is in addition to a valid ticket for the selected travel class.

The only thing you might find disappointing? The entire trip lasts just 3 hours 15 minutes. With those stunning views and unrivalled comfort, the journey is just as spectacular as the destination.


SWISS TRAVEL PASS
This route is fully included in the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) / GA Travelcard, though seat reservations must be paid for separately. 
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]

name: Freddie Mercury Statue
abstract: Freddie Mercury, the singer of the rock band Queen, settled in Montreux where the group had bought Mountain Recording Studio and where he learnt to appreciate the peace and quiet. He recorded his last album, Queen - "Made in Heaven" at the Montreux studio.
description:
The son of a British official of Indian origin, Freddie Mercury (1946-1991) was born on the island of Zanzibar and moved to London where he began his fruitful collaboration with Queen in 1970. 

At the Montreux Jazz Festival in 1978, the singer recorded the album "Jazz" with Queen. He fell in love with Montreux and Lake Geneva and decided to settle here. He said, among other things, "If you want peace of soul, come to Montreux". 

To commemorate his time in Montreux, a bronze statue of Freddie Mercury was placed by the waterfront in 1996. And what of today? Well, his fans still come and place flowers by his monument every day.

More information [https://www.montreuxriviera.com/en/P7643/freddie-mercury-and-queen-in-montreux]

name: Lake Geneva Cruises
abstract: Boat cruising on Central Europe’s largest inland lake every which way. Passengers can embark and disembark on the Swiss as well as the French side of the lake.
description:
The Belle Époque boats have been navigating Central Europe’s largest inland lake for 140 years and offer fantastic cruises between France and Switzerland.

The views from the boat extend from harbours and castles (Chillon, Morges, Rolle, Yvoire among others) over vineyards (Lavaux UNESCO and La Côte) to the snow-covered summits of the Swiss and Savoyan Alps. The boat landings are starting points for many exploration activities like city tours (Geneva, Lausanne, Montreux, Vevey).FACTS

Route: e.g. Geneva – Nyon – Lausanne
Distance: Length of the lake 72 km
Duration: 3 h 45 min

EXCURSION TIPS
 * The Olympic Museum [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/the-olympic-museum/] in Lausanne
 * The Notre-Dame Cathedral [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/notre-dame-cathedral/] of Lausanne
 * Chaplin's World [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/chaplins-world/] in Corsier-sur-Vevey
 * The Cheese Train [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/experiences/cheese-train/] starting in Montreux

FOOD & BEVERAGES

Catering services available in the boat restaurants.TIMETABLE
All connections here [https://www.cgn.ch/en/]TICKET

Ticket
This route is fully covered by the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and GA travelcard.
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/en-ch/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]


Reservations
No seat reservation required – free seating.

name: The Cheese Train
abstract: Rustic and authentic! Enjoy an unforgettable day in Pays-d'Enhaut.
description:
The day begins with a ride on a GoldenPass-MOB scenic train from Montreux or Zweisimmen. In Château-d’Oex, you will discover the secrets of making a Swiss alpine cheese.
At the restaurant Le Chalet, the farmer makes one “Le Chalet Bio” cheese per day from 400 litres of fresh milk in the traditional way – over a wood fire. Enjoy your delicious fondue in this rustic setting. Above the restaurant on the first floor, you will find the GoldenPass MOB trains miniature railway, which will make the eyes of big and small visitors shine brightly. Lastly, a “souvenir bag” will be given to you in the restaurant to remember this truly Swiss experience. In the afternoon visit the Musée du Pays-d'Enhaut where you can discover the treasures of local crafts and the art of paper-cutting.

The return time to your starting point or the onward journey on the GoldenPass MOB trains is at your free choice. Reserving a seat for this is recommended but not included in the price.

FACTS
Route: Montreux/Zweisimmen – Château d’Oex – Montreux/Zweisimmen
Duration: approx. 4 h 

TIMETABLE
The Cheese Train runs from January to October.TICKET
This route is fully covered by the Swiss Travel Pass (Flex) and GA travelcard.
Book tickets [https://www.myswitzerland.com/planning/transport-accommodation/tickets-public-transport/]

address.name: Compagnie du Chemin de Fer Montreux Oberland bernois SA

name: Old Town of Montreux
abstract: The old town of Montreux lies on the hillside of the village. It is around 15 minutes' walk from the lakeshore and, with its cobbled streets and winegrowers' houses, is ideal for a discovery tour or starting point for hikes.
description:
And what a view opens up to the visitor here! Almost at every corner, a new panorama of lake, mountains and forests opens up to the observer. Especially from the forecourt of the St-Vincent church.

Small bistros and cafés invite you to linger. The old town is also the starting point for beautiful hikes, including the famous Chauderon Gorge. The hiking trail to the gorge leads along the Baye de Montreux river to Glion or Les Avants.

name: Christmas in Montreux
abstract: From the shores of Lake Geneva to the surrounding mountains, Festive Montreux (Montreux Noël) offers a great many activities in conjunction with the traditional Christmas Market.
description:
For a whole month the Christmas Market delights the round about 420,000 visitors and offers them a warm and hospitable welcome. 

A visit to the house of the real Father Christmas on the Rocher-de-Naye, a tour of discovery through an authentic Christmas village in Caux, a medieval market and a fairytale festival behind the lofty walls of legendary Chillon Castle: festive Montreux has a lot to offer in addition to the traditional Christmas Market.

More information: Christmas in Montreux [https://www.montreuxnoel.com/en-1-homepage.html]

name: Montreux Ice Rink - skating on the shores of Lake Geneva
abstract: This 300 m2 ice rink in the Montreux market hall may be used free of charge and is open from early January to mid-April.
description:
The ice rink is completely independent of temperature since it is made of synthetic materials, but still provides the feeling of being on real ice. Hence it may be used with the conventional materials and techniques. 

The ice rink is located in the market hall in the heart of Montreux. This historic, late 19th century lakeside architectural monument affords skaters a panoramic view of the Alps and Lake Geneva.

name: Flying over Riviera Montreux and lake Geneva
abstract: Experience the feeling of flying like an eagle, above one of the most beautiful region of Switzerland, with a breathtaking panorama.
description: Skypassion is a famous paragliding tandem flight company in an exceptional setting, between lake and mountains since 2003. The pilots are all qualified and advise each client before the flight. They allow them to feel the pleasure of flying during this experience and always safely. It is the perfect location for a paragliding baptism. Easy takeoff and flight with a stunning view over Lake Geneva with Château de Chillon.

name: Gaze over the Lavaux on a paddleboard
description: Sophie Durant has always lived at Lake Geneva and has got to know the area well from the water too. Her guided half or full-day paddleboard excursions take the group past Montreux, Clarens und Vevey. This is a chance to see the small towns from a different perspective. A walk through the picturesque Lavaux can be combined with a tasting at a local vineyard.

event.location: Le lieu de départ varie selon la balade choisie

name: Balloon Flights over Château-d'Oex
abstract: Château-d'Oex is a hot-air balloon paradise!
description:
In the last week in January every year, Château-d'Oex provides the setting for an international spectacle, which is, in fact, the leading alpine ballooning event: the "Semaine Internationale de Ballons à Air Chaud" (International Hot Air Balloon Week) involves around 90 balloon pilots and is full of fascinating colours and shapes!

Opening hours:
All year round, the professional SkyEvent pilots are available to take you on a hot air balloon flight. It is a unique experience that you can try alone or with family or friends.

How to get to Chateau-d'Oex:
By car: take the A12 motorway, exit at Bulle, follow signs for Chateau-d'Oex. Alternatively, take the A9 motorway and exit at Aigle, then follow signs for Col des Mosses and make your way down to Chateau-d'Oex. From Simmental: take the A6 motorway, exit at Spiez then follow signs for Zweisimmen, Saanen and Gstaad, then Chateau-d'Oex. 
By train: take the MOB line from Montreux to Zweisimmen, via Rossiniere and Gstaad.

name: Dine on the move
abstract: Travelling in style. The trip from Zermatt to St. Moritz/Davos on the Glacier Express is a treat for all the senses as is a gourmet ride on the Golden- Pass Line from the Bernese Oberland to Lucerne. These panoramic routes are among the finest railway experiences to be had anywhere in the world – thanks to the breathtaking views, and to the gastronomic delights served in the dining car. Pure pleasure, in a stunning setting.
description:
GOLDENPASS CLASSIC
The dining car is shaped like a wine barrel. Glass in hand, you’ll glide past the most beautiful parts of Switzerland, from Zweisimmen to Montreux, pampered by the chefs and indulged by the scenery. More Information... [http://www.mob.ch] 

THE SALON BLEU ON WHEELS
The Belle Époque comes to life in this dining car in the legendary style of the Orient Express. Enjoy anything from a glass of champagne to a multi-course menu. Also available for private events. More Information... [http://www.railaway.ch/Deutsch/Extrazug/extrazug_salonBleu.html ] 

FONDUE UP ON THE MOUNTAIN, OR DOWN ON THE LAKE
Fondue is always great fun – even more so when the setting is special. You can enjoy one on Mount Rigi [http://www.rigi.ch], the panoramic mountain high above Lake Lucerne, as you travel on the vintage electric cog wheel railway dating from 1911; or on one of the much-loved fondue cruises [http://www.railaway.ch/Deutsch/Publikumsfahrten/bodenseefahrten.html] on Lake Constance. 

A TASTY TRIP THROUGH GRAUBÜNDEN
Fresh, seasonal cuisine, great wines and fine brandies are all served in the Gourmino, the nostalgic 1930s dining car that travels the network of the Rhaetian Railways. A year-round calendar offers travellers treats ranging from just-picked asparagus to Buurametzgeta (farmhouse meal featuring a variety of cured meats) and seasonal game dishes. More Information... [http://www.rhb.ch]
BREAKFAST WITH BOND – AND OTHER PEAK PLEASURES
Scaling the mighty peaks of the Alps gives you quite an appetite – even when you make the ascent in a cable car or funicular. Thankfully, when you get to the top, there are special treats in store, like the James Bond Breakfast (daily until 11am) at the Piz Gloria revolving restaurant on the Schilthorn [http://www.schilthorn.ch], where “On Her Majesty’s Secret Service” was filmed; or creamy Älplermakkaroni (alpine macaroni and cheese) on the Stanserhorn [http://www.stanserhorn.ch]; or a stylish dinner on the Brienzer Rothorn [http://www.brienz-rothorn-bahn.ch] after a spectacular ride on Switzerland’s oldest steam-powered cog railway.

name: Lac de Taney: Mountain Lake on the Haute-Savoie Border
abstract: This beautiful dark blue lake is surrounded by flower-strewn fields, tall, fragrant fir trees and rocks.
description:
The many flowers here include the alpine rose, monk's hood and mountain violet among others. Frogs croak on the shore and the shady forests nearby attract alpine salamanders. This is not surprising, since the Lac de Taney is well-known for attracting a vast number of amphibians.
This miniature paradise is located at an altitude of 1,500 m and overlooks the Rhone valley. It was declared a national natural heritage site in the Sixties, but thanks to the visionaries of the time, the lake was not exposed to mass tourism as originally planned. It can still be visited, however, and you can even stay in the charming little mountain inn on the Western shore of the lake.
The road leading to Lac de Taney is closed to private vehicles. Hike from Le Flon, the end station of the Swiss Post Bus line.

How to get there:
By car: drive from Montreux via Vouvry / Miex towards Lac de Taney, or use public transport to reach Miex (final hiking trail).

name: Hire a luxury sailing yacht for a dream cruise
abstract: Petite Arvine des Mers du Sud II is a Swiss-registered 38-foot (11m95 long, 3m98 wide) Beneteau Oceanis luxury monohull that can accommodate up to ten guests. To enjoy a cruise in the greatest comfort, the ideal number of passengers is between four and six.
description:
Sailing yacht of the year in 2016, it combines comfort with performance while guaranteeing peerless stability thanks to its deep keel (2m08) and 2.8-tonne bulb.

The yacht boasts two comfortable cabins (with box-spring beds), separate shower and WC, and a large saloon with a dining room and well-equipped kitchen (cooker, microwave, fridge).

Do you hold a sailing licence valid in Switzerland? Then you can be your own skipper after a short ad hoc training session on how to sail the yacht.
No licence or sailing experience? A volunteer skipper (with plenty of experience) will accompany you and teach you basic sailing manoeuvres so that you can try your hand in complete safety.

We will be delighted to prepare a barbecue for you on the rear deck. This deck is covered with a bimini, so that you can enjoy your meal sheltered from the sun/and or wind if necessary.

Each passenger – adult or child – will have life jacket at their disposal; life jackets are also available for small dogs. The rear deck opens up, making it easy to go for a swim. Paddle boards, snorkels, fins and lifebuoys are all available for you on board.

The organiser reserves the right to cancel the cruise in the event of adverse weather (storms, adverse winds, rain, etc).

Meeting point: Marina du Bouveret, Quai Cook (by the Canal Stockalper)


Typical programme

10:00 a.m. Meet at the Marina du Bouveret, Quai Cook
10:30 a.m. Pass through the swing bridge, sail, paddle board or swim in the middle of the lake on request Enjoy a glass of champagne or Petite Arvine, Morand syrups for children
12:45 p.m. Barbecue on board (merguez sausages, chicken, lamb chops) Salad, rice, oak-aged Merlot for four persons, mineral water, craft beer, cheese, Swiss Rock Café
01:45 p.m. Siesta on deck, sail towards Montreux and Chillon Castle
04:00 p.m. Return to Le Bouveret
05:00 p.m. Pass through the swing bridge, return to the Marina du Bouveret

Bookings
Petite Arvine des Mers du Sud II
Tel: +41 79 221 16 56
Email: pamsud@bm-s.ch

name: With Sissi in Montreux
abstract: Empress of Austria and Queen of Hungary, Elisabeth von Wittelsbach, better known as Sissi, loved to flee to the fashionable resort of Montreux when courtly duties started to pall.
description: In the last five years of her life, she came back time and again to Lake Geneva. She liked to explore the region and took trips, for instance, to Rochers-de-Naye and Bex, enjoying the unique lake and mountain panorama. But her life came to a sudden and tragic end when she was murdered by an anarchist while travelling in Geneva in September 1898. Aboard a beautiful vintage minibus, visitors explore the splendour of the Belle Epoque and follow the trail of the unforgettable Empress Elizabeth. The tour takes you through the idyllic scenery of the Riviera to the favourite monuments of the Empress (historic hotels, castles, churches). During this tour you will listen to many fascinating anecdotes about Sissi.

name: Chauderon Gorge
abstract: The natural wilderness is just a few steps away from the old town of Montreux. The La Baye de Montreux River flows through the gorge from the foot of Rochers-de-Naye into Lake Geneva.
description:
The entrance to Chauderon Gorge is just a short walk from the Montreux train station. As soon as you enter, you will forget the city entirely. The scent of wild garlic pervades the air as you follow the trail across both banks while listening to the burbling and gurgling of the Baye de Montreux River. The gorge, which is narrow at the beginning with some areas that are reminiscent of a rain forest, gradually opens up the farther up you go to Les Avant.

If you would like to keep on going, then you can continue on the Sentier des Narcisses trail. a signposted walking trail that passes along meadows, forests and viewing points overlooking Lake Geneva and the Alps. May carpets the path in narcissus blooms and fills the air with their perfume, while the green meadows are covered in a white blanket of May Snow creeping phlox. This rare spectacle attracts numerous visitors every year to the hills of the breathtakingly beautiful Montreux Riviera.

Getting there: By public transport or car to Montreux.

name: Outdoor raclette with a view
abstract: Raclette is one of Switzerland’s most iconic specialities. There’s no better way to enjoy this dish than in the great outdoors.
description: The breathtaking trip by the Montreux Oberland Bernois railway whisks you away from Vevey up to the Pléiades restaurant. This is just 200 metres from the railway station. Here, visitors will find everything they need to enjoy an outdoor raclette. The restaurant is also the starting point for numerous hikes. A hiking map will help you choose a route. The choice is almost endless: you can take a short stroll or a longer, more challenging hike.

name: Swiss Bazaar
description: A paradise for people who want to find ethnic / traditional Swiss items.

name: Covered Market
description: The covered market is one of the main symbols of Montreux and was built between 1891 and 1892. Its metal structure is reminiscent of the famous Victor Baltard Halles in Paris and came from the same workshop that supplied Gustave Eiffel with the materials for his tower.

name: Hoher Kasten – Top of Appenzell
abstract: The views from the platform between Appenzell country and the St. Gallen Rhine Valley are striking, as is the ridge towards Kreuzberge. Since 1964, the cable car from Brülisau (bus from Weissbad) has run directly to the summit. A revolving restaurant with a sun terrace also stands on the extended platform as well as a circular trail around the summit which allows spectacular panoramic views over six countries.
description:
Informative panorama boards and free telescopes with integrated peak identification explain the wider surroundings. Take a stroll or guided tour through the summit's Alpine garden and discover more than 300 species of Alpstein plants. A wheelchair-friendly panoramic trail with attractive viewing spots now leads in a large arc around the restaurant. 

The newly created geologic hike also commences on the Hoher Kasten, explaining the shaping, folds and fractures of the rocky terrain on a total 17 boards. Gondola-style rail leads from Stauberenkanzel to the Rhine Valley – with the geological path leading further afar, via Saxerlücke to the Fählensee lake (total 3 hours 30 min).

INFORMATION
Altitude: 1794m 
Accessibility: 
Bus from Weissbad (Appenzell) to the Brülisau valley station, cable car to the Hoher Kasten 
View: Alpstein (Säntis), Appenzell, Rhine Valley 
Attractions: Over 400 km of alpine hiking trails, all in top condition, Geological Panorama Hiking Trail, summit hike on Europa Rundweg Circular Trail and alpine garden
Culinary aspects: Revolving restaurant and sun terrace, regional specialities, breakfast buffets on weekends 
Overnight stays: no
Groups: Revolving restaurant: 84, maximum 98 seats, middle floor with separate halls for 70 and 80, max 150 guests. Seminar room with 20 places 
Winter: Cable car and restaurant open all year round from April until end of February, March ceased due to maintance reasons; no winter sports operations. 
Special comments: Exclusive Fullmoon dinner and special evenings rides
Please note:Buy your tickets on arrival at the station or via « Hoher Kasten » App.

name: Ebenalp
abstract: Even the Neanderthals came here. Today, the cable car sweeps over the rugged rocks and once inhabited caves to the Ebenalp, the starting point for a wide range of discoveries.
description:
Wasserauen is the last stop on the Appenzell Railway. From there, the ultra-modern cable car carries passengers up the steep 723-metre climb to the Ebenalp (1,644 metres above sea level) in just six minutes.

From the upper station, the path leads down through the prehistoric Wildkirchli caves, which were inhabited around 40,000 years ago, then on to the hermit’s dwelling and the famous Berggasthaus Aescher mountain inn. Prehistoric stone tools were found in the area 100 years ago, evidence that the area was inhabited by hunter-gatherers during the Palaeolithic era (45,000 – 30,000 BC). The remains of cave bears were also found alongside the stone tools.

The Ebenalp is the ideal starting point for numerous easy to challenging hikes in the Alpstein massif. Taking in fragrant alpine meadows, impressive rock formations and magnificent lookout points, the hikes showcase the very best of the Appenzell region.INFORMATION
Altitude: 1,640 metres 
How to get there: Train to Appenzell and on to Wasserauen, cable car to the Ebenalp.
Views: To the Seealp and Meglisalp, Säntis, Altmann and Hoher Kasten, across the Appenzell region and Lake Constance to Germany and further west to the Feldberg 
Attractions: Alpine garden at the Berggasthaus Ebenalp mountain inn 
Food and drink: Hearty, home-style, Appenzell specialities 
Winter: Winter sports area with ski lifts on the Ebenalp 
Special comments: The secure path to the Aescher mountain inn passes through the caves
Discounted mountain ascent with Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard.
Buy your tickets on arrival at the station.



DAY TRIPS TO THE MOUNTAINS
Buy your return rail and mountain ascent tickets now

Timetable and tickets [https://www.sbb.ch/de/kaufen/pages/fahrplan/fahrplan.xhtml?&nach=Ebenalp]

name: Säntis cable car
abstract: The journey in the big Säntis cable car from Schwägalp across the rocky ridges to the mountain station is an impressive experience in itself. And once you reach the “weather mountain”, the view of six different countries will take your breath away.
description:
The railway line to Wasserauen constructed at the beginning of the last century was actually the first section of a planned railway up the Säntis. The railway line never got further than the valley town, however, and so the cable car from Schwägalp to the top of the Säntis was opened in 1935. From the valley station, you glide almost weightlessly up to the imposing summit in around 10 minutes. At 2,502 metres above sea level, on clear days the mountain provides breathtaking views of France, Germany, Italy, Austria, Liechtenstein and Switzerland. 

The Säntis also plays a key role in weather forecasting – a weather station was first installed on the mountain way back in 1882. An experiential world brings the impressive natural phenomena and their elementary effects to life. A second experiential world – “Säntis – the Ice World” – was opened in 2020. Visitors learn all about snow, ice, ice crystals and glaciers through a series of fun activities and displays.

In summer, numerous special experiences such as full moon trips, sunrise ascents or Säntis-Spitzegnoss evenings attract visitors to the mountain.INFORMATION
Altitude: 2,502 m.a.s.l.
How to get there: Train to Urnäsch or Nesslau, PostBus to Schwägalp, cable car to the Säntis in 10 minutes
Views: Across the Appenzell region and the Alpstein mountain range to Lake Constance, Vorarlberg, the Graubünden Alps as far as the Bernina, in particular the Churfirsten range and beyond them the Tödi, Finsteraarhorn, Pilatus and Rigi, and across the Swiss Plateau to the Jura and Black Forest 
Attractions: Identify mountains and valleys from the viewing terraces, enjoy splendid sunrises and sunsets, full moon trips, a night on the Säntis 
Food and drink: Large, modern Säntisgipfel restaurant
Alter Säntis mountain inn (summer only) 
Accommodation: Alter Säntis mountain inn: Double and multi-bed rooms, dormitories (summer only) 
Hotel Schwägalp: Double rooms and tourist dormitories 
Groups: Rooms for events at the summit and at Schwägalp (extensive event brochure available online)
Alter Säntis has space for 90 guests (function room) 
Operating times: Säntis cable car runs all year round (brief closure for maintenance, usually in January/February, check the timetable [https://saentisbahn.ch/en/experience/cablecar/timetable/])
Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard: Discounted mountain ascent with Swiss Travel Pass/GA travelcard. Buy your tickets at the station
Special comments: Charter trips can be arranged outside of the normal timetable with advance notice

name: Appenzell village tour
abstract: With about 7,000 inhabitants, Appenzell is the political, economic and cultural center of Appenzell Innerrhoden, the smallest Swiss canton.
description: A tour around town offers a wealth of interesting information not usually found in day-to-day activities. View the colourful houses along main street, the quaint parish church, castle, village square, artwork on Adlerplatz and living traditions. Join us in Switzerland’s smallest township! Or choose a tour from our diverse array of offers, including a night watchman tour, a culinary village tour or a tasty town tour.

name: Guided tour of Appenzell
abstract: The village guide will take you on a relaxed stroll around the village of Appenzell and tell you all about the region and its people.
description: The colourful houses on the main street, the imposing parish church, the castle, the historic village square (Landsgemeindeplatz), the artwork of Roman Signer at Adlerplatz and the living customs of Appenzell. Enjoy an entrancing and fascinating insight into this traditional Alpine village. Discover the delights of the smallest Swiss capital.

name: Appenzell craftsmanship
description: Erwin Fässler is a native of the Appenzell and familiar with the land and the people. He offers day tours and lets the guests arrange their own programme. They visit belt makers, painters, woodworkers, cheese makers, weavers and farmers to take a glimpse at the cultural landscape of the Appenzell region.

price.description: CHF 0.00 excl. food CHF 0.00 incl. transport

name: Appenzell Railways
abstract: The Appenzell Railways connect the main towns of this charming area, such as St. Gallen with its Abbey Library, Appenzell with its Tudor-style houses, more than a thousand-year-old Herisau and Gossau, dominated by its 13th century castle Oberberg.
description:
Go on a tour of beautiful Appenzellerland and discover its hilly landscape, lush green meadows and farmhouses. The Appenzell Railways (AB) network links the major towns and villages.

It’s also well worth visiting Appenzell itself to admire the traditional Appenzell houses lining the ever-popular main street. If you have a bit more time, we recommend heading up to Säntis (2,502 metres above sea level) or one of the other stunning mountains in the Alpstein massif. Railway geeks will also love the three cogwheel sections. The Discovery Tour is a chance to enjoy two nostalgic cogwheel trains, as well as the Joke Trail (Witzweg) and a gentle boat trip.

Suggested excursions:
Gossau – Appenzell – Wasserauen
- Great choice of packages – Murder on the Railway, Brunch Ride, Fondue Rides, Quöllfrisch Express and many more.
- Alpstein – take a trip up one of the most stunning mountains in Eastern Switzerland
- Various attractions in Appenzell
- Wasserauen Museum – the history of Appenzell Railways
- E-bike hire at Appenzell train station

Trogen – St. Gallen – Appenzell
- Amazing views of the town of St. Gallen from the train
- Several great hiking trails with train connections to Trogen, St. Gallen and Appenzell

Rorschach – Heiden/Rheineck – Walzenhausen
- Discovery Tour – by cable car, postbus and boat through the Appenzell Vorderland region
- Open carriages – feel the summer sun on your face (Rorschach – Heiden)

Altstätten – Gais
- Bike carriers – outdoor fun on sunny summer days
- Open carriages – feel the summer sun on your face
- Tobogganing fun – in winter on the Stoss – Altstätten toboggan run

Timetable
Details of all Appenzell Railways connections can be found here [https://appenzellerbahnen.ch/de/reiseinformationen/fahrplan.html].

Tickets
Free travel with the Swiss Pass, Swiss Flexi Pass and Swiss Youth Pass
50% discount with the Swiss Half Fare Card, from CHF 20 with the OSTWIND 9:00 am day pass

Offers
Book now [https://appenzellerbahnen.ch/de/erlebnisangebote.html]

Reservations
Planning a group or class trip with Appenzell Railways? Please register the group in advance with Appenzell station by calling 071 788 50 50.

name: Appenzell Beer
description:
Brauerei Locher AG was purchased by the Locher family in 1886 and is the last remaining brewery in Appenzell Innerrhoden. This independent family-owned company has been brewing beer for its clientele for five generations now. 

Its speciality beers have achieved wide acclaim as have the company’s traditional beers. The beers are made by hand and according to traditional methods with special attention being paid to the quality of the raw materials. Appenzell beer is available throughout Switzerland with the Quöllfrisch and Vollmond brands being particularly popular.VISITOR EXPERIENCE

Brauquöll ("brewery spring") Appenzell
Come on a fascinating guided tour of the Brauquöll Appenzell and learn lots of interesting things about how we brew our beer. We’ll show you just how we make Appenzell Beer and Säntis Malt from fresh spring water. You’ll also watch a short film about the brewery in our historic hop cellar. 

Brauerei Locher AG looks forward to welcoming you!

name: Kronberg – Mountain and valley in Appenzellerland
abstract: The cable car runs from the Jakobsbad station to the vantage point with its mountain guesthouse. Märliwelt, Zipline-Park and Bobbahn are just as famous as the view at the top, from the Hoher Kasten over the Säntis to the Lütispitz and across to the foothills of the Churfirsten range.
description:
Here you enjoy sweeping views from the Hohen Kasten above Säntis to the Lütispitz and across to the foothills of the Churfirsten range.

Leisurely tours include the 500m, pram-friendly summit walk and the ridge hike past St. James's chapel to the Scheidegg mountain guesthouse – as well as the less strenuous flower-rich trail down to the Schwägalp.

And additional adventure with the bob run or hanging loose (Tarzan style ) as you swing from tree to tree in the popular Zipline park. The enigma trail and the Märliwelt by the valley station make the Kronberg an attractive destination for families and groups.
Altitude: 1663m 
Accessibility: 
Appenzeller rail from Gossau/Herisau or from Appenzell to Jakobsbad, cable car to the Kronberg 
View: Alpstein, Leistchamm, Tödi, Glärnisch and Speer; Appenzell country as far as Lake Constance, Schaffhausen and eastern Switzerland region 
Attractions: Barefoot path to Gontenbad, bob run, zipline park, Märliwelt, the enigma trail
Culinary aspects: Kronberg breakfast buffets, Appenzeller Siedwurst mit Chäshörnli (boiled sausage with macaroni cheese) 
Overnight stays: Double and multi-bed rooms, 33 beds in the dormitory, 10 beds in bedrooms (weekends or on making a booking) 
Groups: Gaststube 130 people, Bistro 40 people; Seminar rooms in the "alten Berggasthaus" 
Winter: longest tobogganing run in the eastern part of Switzerland
Special comments: Solar power Kronberg

name: Kronberg bobsleigh run
abstract: Enjoy a fast ride on the 1,000 meter long Kronberg bob sled run.
description:
On the Kronberg bobsleigh track there is a fun packed ride for you! Take a seat alone or in pairs in a sled securely connected to the rails. After boarding, the path first leads you 450 metres upwards. Here you still have time to relax! Then it's up to you how fast you go, curve by curve, down the 1000-metre descent towards the valley. You decide the speed with the help of the brake lever.It's great fun for the entire family.
The bob sled run is open during summer season, weather permitting. Coming from Appenzell and going in the direction of Urnäsch, you will find Mt. Kronberg on the left-hand side.

name: Lake Fälen: Fascinating Alpstein-Fjord
abstract: A jewel of a lake, embedded between the steep rock cliffs of Widderalpstöcke, and the peaks of the Hundstein in the north, the Altmann, Saxerfirst and the Kreuzberge mountains in the east, Lake Fälen's nearly black water and its constantly changing kaleidoscope of reflections never fails to enchant its visitors.
description:
There are often remnants of snow even in high summer, while gentian and alpine anemones flower in the areas with Southern exposure. A hiking trail runs along the northern shore of the lake, fishermen try their luck here and in the dog days of summer, there is even an intrepid bather or two that brave the chilly waters, at best 18° C. There is a lovely inn, the Bollenwie, a much-visited destination for hikers, mountaineers, and fishermen. Not only is the view phenomenal, but also the Rösti which makes the 2-hour-hike all the more worthwhile.

How to get there:
By publis transportation (train or postbus) or car from St. Gallen/Appenzell to Brülisau. From Brülisau there is a hiking trail leading to Lake Fälen, the hike takes 1 3/4 hours.

name: Geological hiking path Alpstein
abstract: Thanks to its curious rock formations, the Alpsteinmassiv is considered one of the most attractive mountain ranges of Switzerland and a paradise for climbers and anyone interested in geology.
description:
A high altitude hiking trail follows the rib furthest south. The trail begins on the Hoher Kasten, (accessible via aerial cable-car from Brülisau) to the Saxerlücke and Bollenwees. 

The views from the 1800-meter Hohen Kasten encompass Lake Constance, the Vorarlberg Alps, the hilly Appenzell region and more. The 360° panorama is simply breathtaking. The views of the Rhine delta, the Kreuzberge Mountain and other sensational vistas like the "Hundstein, famous among climbers, accompany the hiker on the way to Saxerlücke. Return to Brülisau via Lake Sämtis (return to Bollenwees is also possible).

During the hike 20 orientation panels inform hikers about the creation of this mountain chain. One can see fossils, eroded structures, subterranean draining lakes, folds and fissures.
Hiking time is about three and a half hours, or six hours round trip to Brülisau.

address.name: Hoher Kasten Drehrestaurant und Seilbahn AG

name: Visitors’ Center Brauquöll Appenzell
abstract: Visitors obtain a lot of interesting information about the art of brewing on an exciting tour of Brauquöll Appenzell (Brewery Source Appenzell). The tour enables visitors to learn how Appenzell beer and Säntis Malt are created from fresh spring water.
description:
Brauerei Locher AG was purchased by the Locher family in 1886 and is the last remaining brewery in Appenzell Innerrhoden. A short film in the historic “Hops Cellar” gives viewers insight into the brewery’s operations and the small museum brings the past to life. 

Visitors participating in the tour receive audio equipment with commentary in German, English, French or Italian. Groups can arrange for an Appenzell beer tasting after the audio tour in the historic "Gnoss-Stöbli" (“Tasting Parlor”) – prior reservations are necessary. 

Sönd wöllkomm! – Welcome!

name: Visit to the Alpenbitter works
abstract: When 20-year-old Emil Ebneter started his Appenzell liquor shop in 1902, he laid the foundation for today’s Appenzeller Alpenbitter AG. Take the tour to gain clues to the secret of Appenzeller Alpenbitter.
description: During this guided tour you will not only learn about the secrets of the herb chamber but also all about how they malke what is undoubtedly the most famous Appenzeller. The free tour lasts approx. 1½ hours and includes tasting. Public guided tours are held all year, every Wednesday at 10.00 hrs.

name: Appenzellerland cross-country world
abstract: Sparse forests, snow-covered fields and moors, rolling hills and purest cross-country enjoyment is the best way to describe the surroundings of Appenzell’s Gais cross-country center.
description:
The cross-country area lies at 900 m altitude and is easily reached by either car or public transport. A more than 30-kilometer long trail, suitable for both classic cross-country skiing and skating, leads over meadows and moors of uniquely beautiful snowy landscapes here. And short climbs, easy descents and flat stretches offer plenty of variety.
Altitude: 960 meters above sea level. 
Classic trail: 32km 
Skating: 32km 
Night trail: 3km 
Dog trail:none

name: Puzzle Trail
abstract: With so many themed paths in the charming Appenzell region, hiking is even more eventful. The highlights include the Puzzle Trail in Schwellbrunn which requires both mental and physical fitness.
description:
In addition to the great Puzzle Trail, which is about 8.6 km long and more suitable for adolescents and adults, a shorter family puzzle path will also be available in 2017, focusing especially on children. Each of the two circular paths has 8 puzzle stations with new puzzles every year. Also, pleasant grilling stations with firewood, grill and seating and other unexpected attractions are available on both trails. Furthermore, by handing in their answers to the riddles, all puzzle hikers take part in the annual prize drawing.
Rätselweg Schwellbrunn [http://www.rätselweg.ch ]

name: Treetop path Neckertal
abstract: In Mogelsberg in the Toggenburg holiday region near St. Gallen, the first treetop path in Switzerland was opened in May 2018. The 500-metre disabled-accessible path gently winds from the forest floor into the treetops – a unique nature experience where visitors are at eye level with the flora and fauna.
description:
Around 40 stops invite you to discover the trees, listen to the sounds of the forest, observe the woodland animals or simply relax. The viewing platform extends up over 50 metres from the ground. From here, visitors can enjoy a sweeping view of the entire Neckertal valley as far as Toggenburger Churfirsten and Appenzellerland. 

If you're craving a light snack, cold and warm dishes are offered in the self-service bistro. Around the treetop path, there are also facilities for active recreation and relaxation. A fitness trail, a log cabin, a forest adventure trail, BBQ areas, idyllic rest areas, a children’s playground and a dreamy natural pond. 

Treetop path Neckertal offers wheelchair-friendly parking, with further parking spaces just a 15 to 30-minute walk away. For visitors arriving by public transport, a 40-minute walk leads directly from Mogelsberg train station to Steinwäldli.

image.name: Mogelsberg, Baumwipfelpfad Neckertal
image.copyrightHolder: Partner image for editorial and touristic use / Genossenschaft Baumwipfelpfad Neckertal

name: From Säntis Malt to the Whisky Trek – follow the trail of the water of life
abstract: The Whisky Trek will undoubtedly set the pulse racing of any whisky collector or connoisseur. In fact, you can now upgrade a hike in beautiful surroundings or multiple tours in the Alpstein by adding that something extra for whisky lovers.
description:
Since May 2015, visitors to the Alpstein mountains in the Appenzell Alps can embark on the highest whisky trek in the world. The brainchild of the Locher brewery – famous for its Säntis Malt whisky – and the Bergwirte-Verein Alpstein (Alpstein mountain landlords’ association), the trek offers whisky-tasting like you’ve never experienced it before.Sepp Manser, landlord at the Berggasthaus Meglisalp mountain inn, came up with the idea of creating a whisky trek when he decided to serve up his own, unique version of Säntis Malt in 2012. His idea very swiftly became a reality – all 26 of the associated local mountain inns have now joined the trail, each with their very own barrel of whisky on hand for on-site tasting.Each of these barrels of whisky contains the same basic distillate, Säntis Malt made by the Locher brewery. But that’s where the similarity ends: Each of the barrels is unique, differing from the others in the type of wood used in its construction and its previous contents. The barrels are made from American, Portuguese, French or Russian oak, and were previously filled with desert wine, Merlot, Pinot noir, Sauvignon, Gamay, Zweigelt, port, sherry, rum, bourbon, damson schnapps or even beer. This diversity results in 26 totally unique flavours along the Appenzell Whisky Trek.Just seeing the barrels is an experience, not to mention the tasting of the whisky itself. As well as varying in flavour, the different whiskies each boast a different colour, with shades ranging from amber and white gold through to rose gold and deep copper.The exclusivity of the unique whiskies is upheld by ensuring that they are only available to taste in the individual mountain inn or to buy in small (1dl) or large (5dl) “one-of-a-kind” bottles, each signed personally by the “cask keeper” – the landlord.The Appenzell Whisky Trek has a brand-new attraction:
an exclusive new trophy that you can see and even wear! If you collect all 26 whiskies on the Alpstein whisky trek, you’ll be rewarded with a new “finisher trophy” – an original Appenzell belt with a genuine silver buckle, designed by Alpine saddler Roger Dörig. This reward replaces all previous collectors’ activities.
As of 25 June 2021, every 100ml bottle of whisky you buy now comes with a “Fass-Bon”, or “barrel token”, which can be detached and stuck into the Whisky Trek collector’s pass. Once your pass is full, you will be rewarded with an exclusive leather belt featuring a genuine silver buckle, crafted by artisan leatherworker Roger Dörig (valued at CHF 350). You can choose the colour and length of your belt. The Whisky Trek belt buckle is only available as a Whisky Trek trophy and is not available for purchase. The campaign will run until the end of the 2023 season
The collector’s pass is available from participating mountain inns and from the Locher brewery’s “Brauquöll” visitors’ centre on Brauereiplatz in Appenzell. The belt can also be ordered there, or from Roger Dörig’s shop.
Old, expired Whisky Trek coupons are no longer valid but can be exchanged for a free 100ml bottle in the “Brauquöll” centre. The centre also still sells the decorative 9-bottle wooden storage shelf, which can be used to display your collection of treasures.We hope you enjoy this true feast for the senses in the Alpstein mountains, where the whisky is as breathtakingly unique as the surrounding scenery.


More information:
www.whiskytrek.com [http://www.saentismalt.com/en/whiskytrek.html] www.alpstein.ch [http://www.alpstein.ch]INFORMATION
